contentrichtext.text: '''Preston''' is a [[village]] and [[Civil parishes in England|civil parish]] about {{convert|3|mi|km}} south of [[Hitchin]] in [[Hertfordshire]], [[England]]. [[File:St Martin, Preston, Herts - geograph.org.uk - 471748.jpg|thumb|St Martin, Preston]] The village grew up around the [[Knights Templar|Templar]] holdings at [[Temple Dinsley]], and [[Princess Helena College]] is now on the site. The first church was mentioned in 1252, when six acres (24,000 mÂ²) of land was given to nuns from [[Elstow]], [[Bedfordshire]]. Temple Dinsley passed on to the [[Knights Hospitaller]] after the dissolution of the Templars. When the Hospitallers were in turn dissolved in 1542, the manor went to Sir [[Ralph Sadleir]]. In the 17th century the village became linked with [[John Bunyan]], who used to hold services in a natural [[amphitheatre]] now called Bunyan's Dell. St Martin's, the local [[Anglican]] [[church (building)|church]], opened in 1900. The ruined [[Minsden Chapel]], reputed to be haunted, is located near the village, though is actually in [[Langley, Hertfordshire|Langley]] civil parish. ==External links== {{Commons category|Preston, Hertfordshire}} *[http://www.prestonvillageherts.com/ Preston Village website] {{coord|51.909014|N|0.285301|W|region:GB_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Villages in Hertfordshire]] [[Category:Civil parishes in Hertfordshire]] {{Hertfordshire-geo-stub}}
